subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4.1 fails AllTests with 2 errors
msgSnippet: Robert, The JUnit self-tests make an attempt to execute JUnit on the command line to make sure that the correct exit code is returned.  It appears that

Robert,

The JUnit self-tests make an attempt to execute JUnit on the command 
line to make sure that the correct exit code is returned.  It appears 
that something in your configuration is causing all of these 
command-line executions to fail.  This most likely is a conflict between 
your Java configuration and JUnit's self-test framework, and will likely 
not prevent you from using JUnit for your own tests. You have two options:

1) Ignore the error and get started.
2) Help us out, by setting a breakpoint at TextRunnerTest.execTest.  
Figure out what command it's trying to run, and see if it works on a 
separate command line.  This will help to pinpoint the problem.

Thanks,

    David Saff

robertkhenry wrote:
> I'm trying to get started with JUnit 4.1. After installing JUnit, I 
> typed the recommended command: 
>
> "java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore org.junit.tests.AllTests"
>
> The instructions say that this should result in an "OK" message. I'm 
> getting this result: 
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 261,  Failures: 2
>
> I'm including the exception stack below.
>
> Java is running on Windows XP,
> java version "1.5.0_07"
> Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_07-b03)
> Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_07-b03, mixed mode, sharing)
>
> What am I overlooking?
>
> RK Henry
>
